intro: Drypetes subcrenata, commonly known as the white-flowered drypetes, is a small to medium-sized tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in lowland and hill forests, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
